medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until approximately 3 months before admission, when fatigue, malaise, and light-headedness developed that she attributed to a viral illness. Three weeks before admission, fatigue worsened, and dyspnea on exertion, bruising on the legs, dark urine, and headache developed. She reported significant fatigue, needing assistance with daily activities. Two days before admission, she went to another hospital due to worsening symptoms. During this period, her symptoms progressively intensified.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of depression, anemia (normal hematocrit 6 years before admission), epistaxis during childhood and pregnancy, and a hysterectomy at 22 years of age due to metrorrhagia after a cesarean section. She also experienced a similar illness 3 years prior, characterized by dyspnea, light-headedness, and unintentional weight loss of 18 kg, which resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hyperthyroidism and mother had diabetes mellitus; her siblings and child were healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, does not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs. Born in South America and moved to the U.S. over 10 years ago. Works with children and has recent travel to Central America and the Caribbean.
